summaryText: Wow, what a powerful message about winning God's favor! Pastor Travis Hearn (PT) delivered an incredible sermon diving deep into how we can position ourselves to experience God's extraordinary favor in our lives. He outlined three key ways to win God's favor: through obedience, humility, and faithfulness. PT reminds us that favor isn't just a random blessing, but something we can actively pursue through our intentional relationship with God. I love how he broke down that obedience isn't a restrictive rulebook, but a pathway to blessing - when we follow God's commands, we unlock supernatural opportunities! The most compelling part was his explanation that favor can open doors no money, education, or skill set can. Isn't that amazing? God's favor can advance your life decades ahead in just a single moment! PT's personal stories and practical examples made this message both entertaining and deeply challenging. He's not just preaching theory, but practical kingdom living that can transform how we approach every area of our lives.

versesMentioned.text: With all my heart I want to win your favor.

Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, 'Oh that you would bless me indeed and enlarge my territory, that your hand would be with me, and that you would keep me from evil, that I may not cause pain.' And God granted him what he requested.

If you fully obey the Lord your God and carefully follow all his commands I give you today, the Lord your God will set you high above all the nations on earth. All these blessings will come on you and accompany you if you obey the Lord your God.
Blessed are the meek, for they will inherit the earth.
Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves.
Let love and faithfulness never leave you; bind them around your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart. Then you will win favor and a good name in the sight of God and man.
These are the ones I look on with favor: those who are humble and contrite in spirit, and who tremble at my word.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 25:9: 'He guides the humble in what is right and teaches them his way.'
Monday.action: Spend 15 minutes reflecting on areas where pride might be blocking God's direction in your life. Write down specific instances where you've resisted correction or advice.
Monday.prayer: Lord, reveal any pride in my heart. Help me become more teachable and humble, willing to learn and grow according to Your wisdom. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: James 4:10: 'Humble yourselves before the Lord, and he will lift you up.'
Tuesday.action: Do something today that puts someone else's needs before your own. Look for an opportunity to serve without expecting recognition.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me decrease so that You may increase. Show me practical ways to serve others with a genuine heart of humility. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 11:2: 'When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with humility comes wisdom.'
Wednesday.focus: Recognizing the connection between humility and wisdom
Wednesday.action: Ask a mentor, spouse, or trusted friend where you might need to grow in humility. Be open to their honest feedback.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, give me a teachable spirit. Help me receive correction with grace and use it as an opportunity for growth. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: 1 Peter 5:5: 'God opposes the proud but shows favor to the humble.'
Thursday.focus: Understanding God's perspective on pride and humility
Thursday.action: Examine your social media and personal interactions. Are they self-promoting or genuinely encouraging others?
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me use my words and platforms to lift others up, not build myself up. Guide my communication to reflect Your heart. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Colossians 3:12: 'Therefore, as God's chosen people, holy and dearly loved, clothe yourselves with compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness and patience.'
Friday.action: Intentionally practice patience and gentleness in at least three interactions today, especially in challenging moments.
Friday.prayer: Jesus, transform my heart to reflect Your character. Help me respond to others with Your love and humility. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Micah 6:8: 'He has shown you, O mortal, what is good. And what does the Lord require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.'
Saturday.focus: Walking humbly with God in daily life
Saturday.action: Create a personal inventory of your gifts and talents. Reflect on how you can use them to serve others, not for personal glory.
Saturday.prayer: Heavenly Father, show me how to steward the gifts You've given me with humility and grace. Help me always point others to You. Amen.
